landmarks.name: Kansas City Convention Center
landmarks.description: The main venue for the conference—your HQ for sessions, networking, and events in the heart of downtown Kansas City.

quiz.question: Which iconic feature sits atop the Kansas City Convention Center?

landmarks.name: Loews Kansas City Hotel
landmarks.description: A modern hotel connected to the convention center via an enclosed walkway—perfect for grabbing coffee or relaxing between sessions.

quiz.question: What unique feature does the Loews Kansas City Hotel lobby offer?

landmarks.name: Power & Light District
landmarks.description: A lively entertainment area filled with restaurants, bars, and live music—just a short walk from the convention center.

quiz.question: Which famous Kansas City dish can you find in many Power & Light District restaurants?

landmarks.name: Kauffman Center for the Performing Arts
landmarks.description: An architectural landmark known for its striking shell-like design and world-class performances, just west of the convention center.

quiz.question: The Kauffman Center’s design was inspired by which musical instrument?

landmarks.name: River Market
landmarks.description: Historic district and home to the City Market—one of the region’s largest farmer’s markets—reachable via the free KC Streetcar from downtown.

quiz.question: Which mode of public transportation can take you from the Convention Center to River Market for free?
